alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 6:49PM CDT until July 03 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Lamar. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paris, Reno, Blossom, Lake Crook, Camp Maxey, Powderly, Lake Gibbons, Pat Mayse Lake, Sumner, Arthur City, Novice, Toco, Sun Valley, Midcity, Faught, Globe, Brookston and Tigertown.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
